message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DS

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of Natural Language Processing (cs.CL) because it proposes a new model for abstractive summarization of longer-form documents, which is a common task in NLP. Additionally, the paper mentions using large-scale datasets of scientific papers, which suggests a focus on text-based research. 

The paper may also belong to the Information Retrieval (cs.IR) sub-category because summarization is a common task in IR, and the proposed model could potentially be applied to other types of documents beyond scientific papers. 

The sub-category of Machine Learning (cs.LG) is also likely because the paper proposes a new hierarchical encoder and attentive decoder, which are common components in neural network models for NLP tasks. 

The sub-category of Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) is a possibility because abstractive summarization is a task that requires advanced language understanding and generation capabilities, which are key areas of research in AI. 

Finally, the sub-category of Data Structures and Algorithms (cs.DS) is a less likely possibility, but still plausible because the paper proposes a new model architecture that involves hierarchical encoding and attention mechanisms, which are important concepts in algorithm design and analysis.
